page.title: 20The Manchester Ship Canal
page.content: It is sad to see the Manchester Ship Canal these days. It was opened on 1st. Jan. 1894 and was an immediate success. Streams of ships used it and large docks opened in Manchester and Salford. There were five miles of quays and a giant grain storage elevator. Now everything is closed. The elevator has been demolished and the only ships to use the canal are sludge boats carrying sewage out to sea. The swing bridge never opens and cranes lie idle. It takes so long to cover the the 36 miles from Liverpool to Manchester by water that firms now use lorries along the M62 motorway which connects Liverpool and Manchester. Work has already begun to redevelop Salford Docks as boating marinas surrounded by hotels, restaurants, shops and new housing.
